017package org.microbean.loader.spi;
018
019import java.lang.reflect.Type;
020
021import java.util.ArrayList;
022import java.util.HashMap;
023import java.util.Iterator;
024import java.util.List;
025import java.util.Map;
026import java.util.Objects;
027
028import java.util.function.BiFunction;
029import java.util.function.Supplier;
030
031import org.microbean.invoke.FixedValueSupplier;
032
033import org.microbean.qualifier.Qualifiers;
034
035import org.microbean.loader.api.Loader;
036
037import org.microbean.path.Path;
038import org.microbean.path.Path.Element;
039
040/**
041 * An abstract {@link AbstractProvider} whose implementations are
042 * built around tree structures of various kinds.
043 *
044 * @param <N> the type of a node in the tree
045 *
046 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
047 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
048 */
049public abstract class AbstractTreeBasedProvider<N> extends AbstractProvider {
050
051
052  /*
053   * Constructors.
054   */
055
056
057  /**
058   * Creates a new {@link AbstractTreeBasedProvider} with no
059   * {@linkplain #lowerBound() lower type bound}.
060   */
061  protected AbstractTreeBasedProvider() {
062    this(null);
063  }
064
065  /**
066   * Creates a new {@link AbstractTreeBasedProvider} with the supplied
067   * {@linkplain Provider#lowerBound() lower type bound}.
068   *
069   * @param lowerTypeBound the {@linkplain #lowerBound() lower type
070   * bound}; may be {@code null}
071   */
072  protected AbstractTreeBasedProvider(final Type lowerTypeBound) {
073    super(lowerTypeBound);
074  }
075
076
077  /*
078   * Instance methods.
079   */
080
081
082  /**
083   * Returns the number of child nodes the supplied {@code node} has,
084   * which may be (and often is) {@code 0}.
085   *
086   * <p>If the supplied {@code null} is {@code null}, {@linkplain
087   * #absent(Object) absent} or a scalar, an override of this method
088   * must return {@code 0}.</p>
089   *
090   * @param node the parent node; may be {@code null} in which case
091   * {@code 0} must be returned
092   *
093   * @return the number of child nodes the supplied {@code node} has,
094   * which may be (and often is) {@code 0}
095   *
096   * @nullability Overrides of this method may return {@code null}.
097   *
098   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
099   * deterministic.
100   *
101   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
102   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
103   */
104  // returns 0 if the node is null, missing, scalar
105  protected abstract int size(final N node);
106
107  /**
108   * Returns an {@link Iterator} over the names of the supplied {@code
109   * node}'s child nodes, or an {@linkplain
110   * java.util.Collections#emptyIterator() empty
111   * <code>Iterator</code>} if the supplied {@code node} is
112   * {@linkplain #map(node) not a map node}.
113   *
114   * @param node the parent node; may be {@code null} in which case an
115   * {@linkplain java.util.Collections#emptyIterator() empty
116   * <code>Iterator</code>} must be returned
117   *
118   * @return an {@link Iterator}; never {@code null}
119   *
120   * @nullability Overrides of this method must not return {@code
121   * null}.
122   *
123   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
124   * deterministic.
125   *
126   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
127   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
128   */
129  protected abstract Iterator<String> names(final N node);
130
131  /**
132   * Returns the child node of the supplied parent {@code node}
133   * identified by the supplied {@code name}, or {@code null} if
134   * either the child does not exist or {@code node} is not a
135   * {@linkplain #map(Object) map node}.
136   *
137   * @param node the parent node; may be {@code null} in which case
138   * {@code null} must be returned
139   *
140   * @param name the name of the child; must not be {@code null}
141   *
142   * @return the child node of the supplied parent {@code node}
143   * identified by the supplied {@code name}, or {@code null} if
144   * either the child does not exist or {@code node} is not a
145   * {@linkplain #map(Object) map node}
146   *
147   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code name} is {@code null}
148   *
149   * @nullability Overrides of this method may (and often do) return
150   * {@code null}.
151   *
152   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
153   * deterministic.
154   *
155   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
156   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
157   */
158  protected abstract N get(final N node, final String name);
159
160  /**
161   * Returns the child node of the supplied parent {@code node}
162   * identified by the supplied {@code index}, or {@code null} if
163   * either the child does not exist or {@code node} is not a
164   * {@linkplain #list(Object) list node}.
165   *
166   * @param node the parent node; may be {@code null} in which case
167   * {@code null} must be returned
168   *
169   * @param index the zero-based index of the child
170   *
171   * @return the child node of the supplied parent {@code node}
172   * identified by the supplied {@code name}, or {@code null} if
173   * either the child does not exist or {@code node} is not a
174   * {@linkplain #map(Object) map node}
175   *
176   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code name} is {@code null}
177   *
178   * @exception IndexOutOfBoundsException if {@code index} is invalid
179   *
180   * @nullability Overrides of this method may (and often do) return
181   * {@code null}.
182   *
183   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
184   * deterministic.
185   *
186   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
187   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
188   */
189  protected abstract N get(final N node, final int index);
190
191  /**
192   * Returns {@code true} if the supplied {@code node} is {@code
193   * null}, absent or synthetic.
194   *
195   * @param node the node to test; may be {@code null} in which case
196   * {@code true} must be returned
197   *
198   * @return {@code true} if the supplied {@code node} is {@code
199   * null}, absent or synthetic
200   *
201   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
202   * deterministic.
203   *
204   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
205   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
206   */
207  protected abstract boolean absent(final N node);
208
209  /**
210   * Returns {@code true} if the supplied {@code node} is {@code null}
211   * or represents an explicitly set {@code null} value.
212   *
213   * @param node the node to test; may be {@code null} in which case
214   * {@code true} must be returned
215   *
216   * @return {@code true} if the supplied {@code node} is {@code null}
217   * or represents an explicitly set {@code null} value
218   *
219   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
220   * deterministic.
221   *
222   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
223   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
224   */
225  protected abstract boolean nil(final N node);
226
227  /**
228   * Returns {@code true} if the supplied {@code node} represents a
229   * map, and therefore the {@link #get(Object, String)} method is
230   * likely to be relevant.
231   *
232   * @param node the node to test; may be {@code null} in which case
233   * {@code false} must be returned
234   *
235   * @return {@code true} if the supplied {@code node} represents a
236   * map, and therefore the {@link #get(Object, String)} method is
237   * likely to be relevant
238   *
239   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
240   * deterministic.
241   *
242   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
243   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
244   */
245  protected abstract boolean map(final N node);
246
247  /**
248   * Returns {@code true} if the supplied {@code node} represents a
249   * list or an array, and therefore the {@link #get(Object, int)}
250   * method is likely to be relevant.
251   *
252   * @param node the node to test; may be {@code null} in which case
253   * {@code false} must be returned
254   *
255   * @return {@code true} if the supplied {@code node} represents a
256   * list or an array, and therefore the {@link #get(Object, int)}
257   * method is likely to be relevant
258   *
259   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
260   * deterministic.
261   *
262   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
263   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
264   */
265  protected abstract boolean list(final N node);
266
267  /**
268   * Returns {@code true} if {@code node} is either a {@linkplain
269   * #map(Object) map} or a {@linkplain #list(Object) list or array}.
270   *
271   * @param node the node to test; may be {@code null} in which case
272   * {@code false} must be returned
273   *
274   * @return {@code true} if {@code node} is either a {@linkplain
275   * #map(Object) map} or a {@linkplain #list(Object) list or array}
276   *
277   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
278   * deterministic.
279   *
280   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
281   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
282   */
283  protected final boolean container(final N node) {
284    return !nil(node) && (map(node) || list(node));
285  }
286
287  /**
288   * Returns a {@link BiFunction} accepting a node and a {@link Type}
289   * and returning the result of reading an object of that type, or
290   * {@code null} if no such {@link BiFunction} could be sourced.
291   *
292   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} currently executing a
293   * request; must not be {@code null}
294   *
295   * @param absolutePath the path being requested; must not be {@code
296   * null} and must be {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}
297   *
298   * @return a {@link BiFunction} accepting a node and a {@link Type}
299   * and returning the result of reading an object of that type, or
300   * {@code null} if no such {@link BiFunction} could be sourced
301   *
302   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
303   *
304   * @nullability Overrides of this method may return {@code null}.
305   *
306   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
307   * deterministic.
308   *
309   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
310   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
311   */
312  protected abstract BiFunction<? super N, ? super Type, ?> reader(final Loader<?> requestor,
313                                                                   final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath);
314
315  /**
316   * Returns the root node of the tree that is suitable for the
317   * supplied {@link Loader} and {@link Path}, or {@code null} if no
318   * tree is suitable.
319   *
320   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} currently executing a
321   * request; must not be {@code null}
322   *
323   * @param absolutePath the path being requested; must not be {@code
324   * null} and must be {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}
325   *
326   * @return the root node, or {@code null}
327   *
328   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
329   *
330   * @nullability Overrides of this method may return {@code null}.
331   *
332   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
333   * deterministic.
334   *
335   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
336   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
337   */
338  protected abstract N rootNode(final Loader<?> requestor, final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath);
339
340  /**
341   * Returns a node possibly containing qualifiers applicable to the
342   * supplied node, or {@code null}.
343   *
344   * @param node the node for which a corresponding qualifiers node
345   * should be returned; may be {@code null} in which case {@code
346   * null} must be returned
347   *
348   * @return a node possibly containing qualifiers applicable to the
349   * supplied node, or {@code null}
350   *
351   * @nullability Overrides of this method may (and often do) return
352   * {@code null}
353   *
354   * @idempotency Overrides of this method must be idempotent and
355   * deterministic.
356   *
357   * @threadsafety Overrides of this method must be safe for
358   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
359   */
360  protected abstract N qualifiers(final N node);
361
362  /**
363   * Returns a {@linkplain FixedValueSupplier#of(Supplier)
364   * deterministic <code>Supplier</code>} suitable for the current
365   * request, represented by the supplied {@code absolutePath}, as
366   * being executed by the supplied {@link Loader}, or {@code null} if
367   * no such {@link Supplier} is or ever will be suitable.
368   *
369   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} currently executing a
370   * request; must not be {@code null}
371   *
372   * @param absolutePath the path being requested; must not be {@code
373   * null} and must be {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}
374   *
375   * @return a {@link Supplier}, or {@code null}
376   *
377   * @exception NullPointerException if any argument is {@code null}
378   *
379   * @idempotency No guarantees are made of either idempotency or
380   * determinism, either of this implementation or of its overrides.
381   *
382   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
383   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
384   *
385   * @see Provider#get(Loader, Path)
386   */
387  @Override // Provider
388  protected Supplier<?> find(final Loader<?> requestor, final Path<? extends Type> absolutePath) {
389    assert absolutePath.absolute();
390    assert absolutePath.startsWith(requestor.path());
391    assert !absolutePath.equals(requestor.path());
392
393    final int size = absolutePath.size();
394    assert size > 1; // follows from the above
395
396    N node = this.rootNode(requestor, absolutePath);
397    if (node != null) {
398
399      final BiFunction<? super N, ? super Type, ?> reader = this.reader(requestor, absolutePath);
400      if (reader != null) {
401
402        boolean containerNode = container(node);
403
404        for (int i = 1; i < size; i++) { // note that i is 1 on purpose; we skip the first root-designating element
405          final Element<?> element = absolutePath.get(i);
406          final String name = element.name();
407
408          if (name.isEmpty()) {
409            // Empty name means "the current node". The node remains
410            // what it was.
411            continue;
412          }
413
414          if (!containerNode) {
415            // The name was non-empty, and the prior node was not a
416            // container, so we would be trying to dereference the
417            // name against a value node or a missing node, either of
418            // which is impossible.
419            node = null;
420            break;
421          }
422
423          if (!container(node)) {
424            // The next path element may have an empty name, in which
425            // case it will refer to this node, so the fact that it is
426            // not a container is still as of this moment OK.  Record
427            // this fact so we can make sure on the next pass.
428            // valuePathElements.add(element);
429            containerNode = false;
430            continue;
431          }
432
433          if (list(node)) {
434            node = handleListNode(element, node);
435          } else if (map(node)) {
436            node = get(node, name);
437          } else {
438            throw new AssertionError();
439          }
440          if (node == null) {
441            break;
442          }
443
444        }
445
446        if (node != null) {
447          return FixedValueSupplier.of(reader.apply(node, absolutePath.qualified()));
448        }
449      }
450    }
451    return null;
452  }
453
454  /**
455   * Calls the {@link #path(Loader, Path, BiFunction)} method with the
456   * supplied arguments and the return value of an invocation of the
457   * {@link #reader(Loader, Path)} method and returns its result.
458   *
459   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} currently executing a
460   * request; must not be {@code null}
461   *
462   * @param absolutePath the path being requested; must not be {@code
463   * null} and must be {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}
464   *
465   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code absolutePath} or {@code
466   * reader} is {@code null}
467   *
468   * @nullability This method does not return {@code null}.
469   *
470   * @idempotency No guarantees about idempotency or determinism are
471   * made of this method.
472   *
473   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
474   * threads.
475   *
476   * @see #path(Loader, Path, BiFunction)
477   *
478   * @see #reader(Loader, Path)
479   */
480  @Override
481  protected final <T extends Type> Path<T> path(final Loader<?> requestor, final Path<T> absolutePath) {
482    return this.path(requestor, absolutePath, this.reader(requestor, absolutePath));
483  }
484
485  /**
486   * Returns a {@link Path} for a new {@link Value} that will be
487   * returned by the {@link #get(Loader, Path)} method.
488   *
489   * <p>The default implementation of this method attempts to build a
490   * {@link Path} with the same {@linkplain Path#size() sizze} as the
491   * supplied {@link Path} and differing, perhaps, only in the {@link
492   * Qualifiers} assigned to each {@link Element}.</p>
493   *
494   * <p>Overrides of this method must not call the {@link
495   * #path(Loader, Path)} or the {@link #get(Loader, Path)} methods or
496   * undefined behavior, such as an infinite loop, may result.</p>
497   *
498   * @param <T> the type of the supplied {@link Path} and the returned
499   * {@link Path}
500   *
501   * @param requestor the {@link Loader} currently executing a
502   * request; must not be {@code null}
503   *
504   * @param absolutePath the path being requested; must not be {@code
505   * null} and must be {@linkplain Path#absolute() absolute}
506   *
507   * @param reader a {@link BiFunction} accepting a node and a {@link
508   * Type} and returning the result of reading an object of that type;
509   * may be {@code null}
510   *
511   * @return a {@link Path}; never {@code null}; sometimes simply the
512   * supplied {@code absolutePath}
513   *
514   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code absolutePath} or {@code
515   * reader} is {@code null}
516   *
517   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
518   * return {@code null}.
519   *
520   * @idempotency No guarantees about idempotency or determinism are
521   * made of this method or its overrides.
522   *
523   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
524   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
525   */
526  protected <T extends Type> Path<T> path(final Loader<?> requestor,
527                                          final Path<T> absolutePath,
528                                          final BiFunction<? super N, ? super Type, ?> reader) {
529    final int size = absolutePath.size();
530    if (size <= 1) {
531      return absolutePath;
532    }
533
534    N node = this.rootNode(requestor, absolutePath);
535    if (node == null) {
536      return absolutePath;
537    }
538
539    Element<?> element = absolutePath.get(0);
540    assert element.isRoot();
541
542    String nextName = absolutePath.get(1).name();
543
544    final List<Element<?>> valuePathElements = new ArrayList<>(size);
545    valuePathElements.add(element);
546
547    N qualifiersNode = qualifiers(node); // often gets a child of this node named "@qualifiers"
548    final Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> valuePathQualifiers = this.qualifiers(reader, qualifiersNode, nextName);
549    qualifiersNode = this.get(qualifiersNode, nextName);
550
551    boolean containerNode = this.container(node);
552
553    for (int i = 1; i < size; i++) {
554      element = absolutePath.get(i);
555      final String name = element.name();
556
557      if (name.isEmpty()) {
558        // Empty name means "the current node". The node remains what
559        // it was.
560        valuePathElements.add(element);
561        continue;
562      }
563
564      if (!containerNode) {
565        // The name was non-empty, and the prior node was not a
566        // container, so we would be trying to dereference the name
567        // against a value node or a missing node, either of which is
568        // impossible.
569        return absolutePath;
570      }
571
572      if (!this.container(node)) {
573        // The next path element may have an empty name, in which case
574        // it will refer to this node, so the fact that it is not a
575        // container is still as of this moment OK.  Record this fact
576        // so we can make sure on the next pass.
577        valuePathElements.add(element);
578        containerNode = false;
579        continue;
580      }
581
582      final boolean hasNext = i + 1 < size;
583      nextName = hasNext ? absolutePath.get(i + 1).name() : null;
584      valuePathElements.add(Element.of(qualifiers(reader, qualifiersNode, nextName),
585                                       element.qualified(),
586                                       name));
587      qualifiersNode = this.get(qualifiersNode, nextName);
588    }
589    @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
590    final Element<T> last = (Element<T>)valuePathElements.remove(valuePathElements.size() - 1);
591    return Path.of(valuePathQualifiers, valuePathElements, last);
592  }
593
594  /**
595   * Returns a {@link Qualifiers} derived from the supplied {@code
596   * qualifiersNode}.
597   *
598   * @param reader a {@link BiFunction} accepting a node and a {@link
599   * Type} and returning the result of reading an object of that type;
600   * may be {@code null}
601   *
602   * @param qualifiersNode a node {@linkplain #names(Object)
603   * containing} qualifier entries; may be {@code null}
604   *
605   * @param nextPathElementName the name of the next path element; may
606   * be {@code null}
607   *
608   * @return a {@link Qualifiers}; never {@code null}
609   *
610   * @nullability This method does not, and its overrides must not,
611   * return {@code null}.
612   *
613   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
614   * idempotent and deterministic.
615   *
616   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
617   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
618   */
619  protected Qualifiers<? extends String, ?> qualifiers(final BiFunction<? super N, ? super Type, ?> reader,
620                                                       final N qualifiersNode,
621                                                       final String nextPathElementName) {
622    if (qualifiersNode == null || reader == null || size(qualifiersNode) <= 0) {
623      return Qualifiers.of();
624    } else {
625      final Map<String, Object> qualifiersMap;
626      final Iterator<? extends String> fieldNamesIterator = names(qualifiersNode);
627      if (fieldNamesIterator.hasNext()) {
628        qualifiersMap = new HashMap<>();
629        while (fieldNamesIterator.hasNext()) {
630          final String qualifierKey = fieldNamesIterator.next();
631          final N qualifierValueNode = get(qualifiersNode, qualifierKey);
632          assert qualifierValueNode != null; // ...or it shouldn't have been iterated
633          assert !absent(qualifierValueNode); // never returned by get()
634          if (!map(qualifierValueNode) || !qualifierKey.equals(nextPathElementName)) {
635            final Object qualifierValue = reader.apply(qualifierValueNode, Object.class);
636            if (qualifierValue != null) {
637              qualifiersMap.put(qualifierKey, qualifierValue);
638            }
639          }
640        }
641      } else {
642        qualifiersMap = Map.of();
643      }
644      return qualifiersMap.isEmpty() ? Qualifiers.of() : Qualifiers.of(qualifiersMap);
645    }
646  }
647
648  private final N handleListNode(final Element<?> element, N node) {
649    final String key;
650    final Qualifiers<String, Object> q = element.qualifiers();
651    if (q.containsKey("index")) {
652      key = "index";
653    } else if (q.containsKey("arg0")) {
654      key = "arg0";
655    } else {
656      return null;
657    }
658    final Object o = q.get(key);
659    assert o != null; // qualifiers can't contain null values
660    int index;
661    if (o instanceof Number n) {
662      index = n.intValue();
663    } else {
664      try {
665        index = Integer.parseInt(o.toString());
666      } catch (final NumberFormatException numberFormatException) {
667        return null;
668      }
669    }
670    return get(node, index);
671  }
672
673}
